page.title: 16Peak National Park
page.content: The area is in the{Peak National Park which was established in 1951. It covers an area of 542 square miles, has a population of approx. 40,000 and attracts about 16 million visitors annually. The Park is administered by the Peak Park Joint Planning Board and its{aims are to{conserve the landscape}and {provide recreation}while considering the needs of the local residents. Most of the land is used for farming and about 6 million tons of limestone are extracted annually from the quarries in the Park. There are also extensive areas of wild moorland much of which is covered by access agreements. Most of the Peak Park is privately owned or by such organisations as the National Trust.
